questions.question: A child slides down a plastic slide, gets up, touches a metal ladder, and feels a shock. Which of the following COULD explain this experience?

answers.text: As the child went down the slide, electrons entered their body. When they touched the metal ladder, those electrons flew off and created a show.
As the child went down the slide, protons entered their body. When they touched the metal ladder, those protons flew off and created a show.

questions.question: A child slides down a plastic slide, gets up, touches a metal ladder, and feels a shock. If the child wanted to avoid the shock, what could they have done? Check all that apply.

answers.text: Waited and did not move for 20 seconds before touching the metal, allowing electrons to leave their body.
Only go down the slide on rainy days.
There is no way for the child to avoid being shocked.
Make sure to move very fast while touching the metal.
Touch an insulator before touching the metal.
